item.title: Euro Seen Vulnerable to Further Falls Versus Dollar
item.description: The euro has been on a downward trend against the dollar since the ECB’s May 4 meeting and is vulnerable to further falls, SEB said.

item.title: Credit Suisse Loses Case Against Georgian Businessman in Singapore
item.description: A Singapore court has ordered a unit of Credit Suisse to compensate Georgian businessman Bidzina Ivanishvili for its failure in safeguarding the plaintiff’s assets.

item.title: Oil Edges Up After Russia Doubts OPEC Will Act on Output
item.description: Oil prices wavered in Europe, having tumbled on Thursday after comments from Russia’s deputy minister scrambled investors’ expectations for OPEC+ plans.

item.title: Metals Rally Amid Hopes of Agreement on US Debt Ceiling
item.description: Base metals and gold prices were rising as improvements in sentiment over the debt ceiling talks plus positive economic data from the U.S. is helping to boost the macro mood, Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: Rating Downgrade Is a Risk for 10-Year French-German Yield Spread
item.description: SocGen reiterated its pessimistic view on the 10-year French OAT-German Bund yield spread with rating downgrade risks looming.

item.title: UK Retail Sales Rebound
item.description: U.K. retail-sales volumes rose by a more-than-expected 0.5% in April, recovering from a rain-hit March that affected non-food sales, with easing energy prices lifting some of the pressures on household spending.

item.title: London Stocks Open Higher on Tentative Signs of US Debt Deal Progress
item.description: The FTSE 100 opened up 0.5%, helped by gains in Asia and some signs of progress on the U.S. debt ceiling talks, but IG said sentiment remained fragile due to concerns the June 1 deadline for an agreement is fast approaching and with a U.S. rate rise next month looking increasingly likely.

item.title: Casino to Start Talks With Creditors; Offload Some Stores
item.description: Casino has opened a conciliation procedure with its creditors over planned debt talks and has agreed to sell a number of its stores in France to Intermarche.

item.title: Record $279 Million Whistleblower Award Went to a Tipster on Ericsson
item.description: The largest-ever award in the SEC’s cash-for-tips program was related to a bribery case against the telecommunications company.

item.title: Munis on Edge as Debt Ceiling Deadline Nears
item.description: City and state governments fear a potential surge in borrowing costs and curtailed federal spending.

item.title: Did Merkel Pave the Way for the War in Ukraine?
item.description: The former German chancellor is unapologetic as critics reexamine her deals with Putin and reluctance to punish his previous aggressions.

item.title: Tesla is opening some of its fast-charging network to Ford customers in the U.S. and Canada, the companies' chief executives said in a joint appearance.
item.description: Tesla is opening some of its fast-charging network to Ford customers in the U.S. and Canada, the companies’ chief executives said in a joint appearance.

item.title: TikTok is testing a chatbot powered by generative artificial intelligence that is designed to help its users find content and get recommendations for more.
item.description: TikTok is testing a chatbot powered by generative artificial intelligence that is designed to help its users find content and get recommendations for more.

item.title: Dish Network is in talks to sell wireless plans for its nascent mobile phone service through Amazon.com, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Dish Network is in talks to sell wireless plans for its nascent mobile phone service through Amazon.com, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Illumina shareholders voted to elect one of activist investor Icahn's three nominees to the company's board, giving him a partial victory in a proxy battle.
item.description: Illumina shareholders voted to elect one of activist investor Icahn’s three nominees to the company’s board, giving him a partial victory in a proxy battle.

item.title: Nvidia's results lifted technology stocks despite surging bond yields, helping the Nasdaq to a 1.7% gain. The S&P 500 rose 0.9%, while the Dow fell 0.1%.
item.description: Nvidia’s results lifted technology stocks despite surging bond yields, helping the Nasdaq to a 1.7% gain. The S&P 500 rose 0.9%, while the Dow fell 0.1%.

item.title: Germany slipped into recession during the first three months of the year, as households cut spending in response to sharply higher prices for energy and food.
item.description: Germany slipped into recession during the first three months of the year, as households cut spending in response to sharply higher prices for energy and food.

item.title: Paramount Global's controlling shareholder, National Amusements, secured a $125 million investment from merchant bank BDT & MSD Partners, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.description: Paramount Global’s controlling shareholder, National Amusements, secured a $125 million investment from merchant bank BDT & MSD Partners, according to people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Shares of Nvidia soared more than 24%, putting it on the cusp of becoming the first $1 trillion chip company, after it said on Wednesday that the artificial-intelligence boom is trans-lating into record sales.
item.description: Shares of Nvidia soared more than 24%, putting it on the cusp of becoming the first $1 trillion chip company, after it said on Wednesday that the artificial-intelligence boom is trans-lating into record sales.

item.title: Biden nominated Air Force Gen. Charles Q. Brown Jr. to succeed Army Gen. Mark Milley as chairman of the Joint Chiefs.
item.description: Biden nominated Air Force Gen. Charles Q. Brown Jr. to succeed Army Gen. Mark Milley as chairman of the Joint Chiefs.
